reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is a polished spooky hide and seek game combined with some interesting rules.
This game is not only focusing on horror! There isn't even a horror tag on it's store page but it's still scary for a lot of people :P

You will normally start as human and the lucky one will be the ghost. Humans can't attack but they can run and hide. They also have a flashlight, EMF device to determine if the ghost are nearby and see it's aura if it's in invisible mode. They also have the ability to switch into all the different security camera views . The ghost has to catch the players. It also can taunt the players which is a lot of fun!

A big plus in this game is the beautiful leveldesign. There are only 3 maps but they are big and offers a lot of hiding spots! Crates are lying around and can be used to make a hiding spot. A lot of secret areas are on each map which give the human a chance to escape from the ghost :)

There are two gamemodes:

Seek and ReapThis gamemode is fast paced. The ghost can activate his vision to find humans and stay in invisible mode for a limited time. There is also the double jump which human can't do. Once he reaped a human it will turn into his minion and help him to catch the rest of the group which also can do double jump and detect where humans are.

The humans are pretty much ♥♥♥♥ed up at this point but luckily they can do more than just run and hide in this gamemode. There are two extra skills in this gamemode. The humans can cast up to 3 invisible shield that will block the ghost for a short time. They can also deploy clones...yes you heard it right! You can go ninja and deploy up to 2 clones each round to confuse the ghost. This gamemode is played mostly in this game but I would recommend the other gamemode to players who like it more stealthy...

BountyThis gamemode is my favourite one. In this gamemode you have to be more careful with your stamina since it will refill very slowly compared to Seek and Reap. The ghost can't double jump nor using his vision to find the survivors but it is invisible forever, can see running survivors through walls and deploy up to 3 banshee's. Those things are like detectors, it is invisible if the survivor doesn't use his EMF device. On contact it will scream, slow down the human and tell the ghost it's location.

The humans goal in this gamemode is to find 10 watchers to create a portal and escape. If a watcher is nearby, it will play a sound and glow. If the ghost catches one of the humans it will turn into a spectre that can't attack but it can still interact with the world like pressing on buttons, open doors and moving crates around. The main focus in this game is hiding from the ghost and searching for watchers. Walking creates noises so the best strategy is to crouch if a ghost is nearby and find a good hiding spot :) Such tense situation will make your heart race and you will pray that it won't find you :D

ConclusionI think I turned my review into a beginner guide lol
Well, a lot of people compare this game with Damned and IMO the mechanic is a little similar to Damned but much more polished and it is still EA so there will be more surprises in the future :) Definitely worth the full price! Buy it now while it's still hot and support the developers! Thanks for reading :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, Dead Realm, In short I do recommend the game so long as you and your friends all buy them together, otherwise you'll be plagued by solo joining and annoying youtuber fans who screech catch phrases at every little thing, along with constantly being asked to not use foul language because they are recording.

Yea the people sometimes suck but the game itself is fantastic, it's essentially the same old hide and seek you grew up with and eventually played in garrys mod I'm sure. While not as expansive as Garrys Mod is now with the maps and such, Dead Realm has the core gameplay down pat, great horror feels, good mechanics and diverse maps keep the fun going, but with only three maps total the hiding spots tend to be the same.

Unfortunately the worst issue is the VOIP system, There is no Push to Talk, and there is no Voice Activation system. The VOIP Chat is reduced to Toggle On/Off, Which means often you'll be in lobbies with young children who are screaming and hollering at every door opening and not knowing their mic is open, Or you get into lobbies where people know this, and still not toggle off and blow your ears out.

Still a fun game, but yea the people suck so buy it with friends or wish for the best.

*Serious Review*

DESCRIPTION:

Dead Realm is a magnificent multiplayer game. Whether you are a nervous, quaking human hiding in the corner or the malicious, bloodthirsty monster preying on the weak, you will enjoy every second of this game. There are two gamemodes called Seek and Reap" and "Bounty
date: and each one is unique.\nIn Seek and Reap, the humans' goal is to remain hidden for the entire time limit without being caught by the monster. They can employ shields and decoys to aid them. If a human is caught by the monster, they are reaped
recommended:
meaning they are killed and turned into a spirit. Spirits then aid the monster in hunting the remaining humans. The monster wins if all humans are reaped by the end of the time limit. The humans win if at least one human is alive when time runs out. The ghost can detect the humans' locations and briefly turn invisible to help in slaying the humans.
Bounty is a little different. In Bounty, the humans must find 10 pocket watches within the allotted time, or they lose. Once they find all 10, they must reach a portal to escape. The monster cannot detect the humans in this gamemode, and it remains invisible until it reaps a human. The monster also can summon banshees, which will jumpscare humans and alert the monster to their prescence. Spirits cannot reap in Bounty; all they can do is mess with the environment. Humans cannot use shields or decoys either.
No matter which gamemode you play, it is a very fun game and it never gets old. I definitely recommend this game to everyone, especially if you want to play with friends.

PROS AND CONS:

Pros:
-EXCELLENT game to play with friends
-Not a true-blue horror game, but still tense and very creepy
-Both gamemodes are unique

Cons:
-Little content (only 3 maps, 2 monsters, and 2 gamemodes), but since it's early access, this is forgivable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DEAD REALM - Review.

Dead Realm is Horror Hide & Seek in a nutshell. You start off either being the ghost/monster or you can be up to 8 players trying to hide from the monster until the time runs down. Naturally this would seem like a copycat to many mods on Gmod that allow a hide and seek type scenario but this is a bit different. In Dead Realm you are faced with strategic abilities that may make or break your chances at survival or dominance in the case of the ghost.

There are two game modes.
- Seek & Reap
- Bounty
Seek and Reap is basically your basic game of hide & seek, you have a set time limit you have to achieve in order to win whilst being granted 5 special abilities, You can clone yourself 2 times as a human, and use your shield up to 3 times. You can also take full advantage by using a camera monitor system similar to FNAF's. There is a meter in the far right corner that drains battery as you use your camera feature however so only use it in dire situations.
As the monster you have the ability to go invisible for a shirt period of time as it drains your stamina bar, you can also see through walls and find red heat signatures that show human players nearby or far away. If a ghost reaps a player, that player becomes an enemy ghost and will be able to reap other players.

Bounty mode - Bounty is a bit different where it's a basic game of Find the clues, escape whilst also being chased by a bloodthirsty ghost. In this mode, the players are tasked finding pocket watches left by the millionaire  Mr. Huxley " who according to the lore of the game murdered his wife and child and was either overtaken by darkness or left his mansion. You are tasked to find 10 watches left by Huxley all while avoiding reaping from the ghosts of his manor. (1 ghost) in the end of the game you are to run to a portal to escape the mansion
date: all while still being hunted. The ghost can see you but he has lower stamina and he cannot turn the souls he reaps into evil ghosts either.\n\nMultiplayer - The multiplayer gaming system is peer to peer which always means
recommended:
the people with the better internet reign supreme. This is bad because it causes major desynchs at times and major errors such as " YOU ARE BANNED " which has happened to me quite a lot.

PROS -

-  Unique atmospheric multiplayer horror game
- Fun with friends
- Creative mechanics
- New horror concept (Kind-of)
- Music is similar to a mix of Skyrim & Dead Island.
- Good User Interface
- Places to hide
hoursPlayed:
unique locations

- CONS

- Peer to Peer Multiplayer gaming
- Limit of monsters and locations
- Two game modes (Both fun however)
- Basic multiplayer jump scare type game (Unique but could be darker and more ominous)


REPLAY VALUE - 8.4/10 - I'd play this only with friends or if I want to stream or record
voteText:
or if I'm feeling a bit bored.

FINAL VERDICT - 7.9/10 - VERY GOOD

It's not often I say this about horror games since this technically isn't a horror game it's simply a multiplayer hide & seek horror aspect put into it. I will say this is a good game with loads of potential and I'm hoping the developers consider the possibilities in the near future and listen to some of the fan suggestions.


I recommend getting this game if you'd like to scare or get scared by your friends.
"

==========================================
[31/07/2015] Update; More serious review.

Ok. I spent a night playing this game with one my friends and honestly it's going to be a hit and miss for some people. that's for sure.

Graphics: The graphics are simple and can be compared to a slightly better version of GMOD but there is still definitely a creepy atmosphere regardless of the quality. I am running everything on ultra and I haven't found anything visually damaging to my eyes.

Mechanics: The current game mechanics are all working pretty well, there are some things which feel a little clunky such as the doors but this is a very minor issue. You can enjoy a game with your friends or even strangers without any frustating problems. Note: There is no text chat feature currently which means the only way to talk is via mic.

Animations: Jump scare animations are quite good, besides that a new animation set could be in order. The current one is fine but I believe they can do much better at a later date.

Gameplay: This is where the hit and miss really comes in. For me, I can scare quite easily on horror games, although some people can't. That being said, I've known my friends to scream often at this game. This is a sort've cross between GMOD Hide n Seek and possibly Slender. (Especially Bounty game mode) The maps are pretty extensive and it's very easy to get lost. There are a lot of hidden doors, passageways and what not. The biggest fear factor of this game is that the enemy is human controlled and you never know when you're going to get jump scared. That being said, I do reccommend this game with friends and not for sole players looking for 'serious' games.

Overall score 8/10, there is room for improvement but things are on a pretty good solid foundation so it should only be up from here ^^

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Going to do a casual review for now and update when more is added to the game. On launch, it's a good early access. There's some optimization to be done, and the walking animation is a bit goofy, but the three maps they have currently are all very fun, expansive, & detailed. The two monsters are different and interesting and mix-up how you play, as do the two game modes (the first game mode is basically similar to a Damned/Slender, you need to collect 10 stop watches while the monster is invisible except for on your phone, the second is an 'infection' mode where the monsters kill humans, who turn into malicious spirits to kill more humans).

You can play in a lobby with between 2-8 people, the lobbies are good, don't need to forward ports and hosting is easy, along with some good customization in the lobby for things like time, rounds, etc.

Game is good for a few rounds or hours, but the concept is executed well. I found it less scary and more exciting and fun with some really tense and clutch moments. Both modes out feel different and change the tone of rounds considerably. This game will be made or broke by support to the title, I can see this being a real gem of a multiplayer horror game if they add more maps/monsters/modes at a pretty steady rate, what's there now is quite fun and the seven friends I played with and myself all enjoyed it.

While I personally don't find it hugely scary, I did find it a lot of fun, tense, and I did have panic moments when a monster was on my tail or if I was hiding and hoping to god they wouldn't spot or sense me.

TL;DR - Game is fun, content there currently is fun, needs more of it but a very good Day 1 Early Access, has some kinks but nothing game-breaking, this is a good pick-up-and-play game that is good for a few hour sessions every once in a while, and with more content could get addicting. Look forward to see what it becomes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is a great little game with huge potential in the future; it's not something you can sit down for hours playing at the minute due to the limited number of maps and ghosts but for an early access game it's very much a complete package which just screams This is going to be awesome"

The only down sides to the game I can see at the minute are:

- Lack of servers due to players having to create their own; but on the flip side of this when I haven't seen a lobby I have created my own (at various time from 4am to 4pm) and people join almost instantly

- Lack of maps; only 3 so far but each one is highly unique filled with brilliant hiding spots

- Only 2 ghosts; cannot wait to see what the devs come up with and I hope to god they listen to the community as the possibilities are endless

Is it worth the price tag? Sure
recommended: £10 is not a lot of money these days and I feel theres easily hours of fun to be had in the state the game is in now and once new updates come out with more content you will certainly find yourself coming back to the game. reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game was awesome, and so much fun to play... then the Nov 2015 update was released, and major bugs [extreme lag, and random mouse spins making player control frustrating] broke the game for everybody.

It has now been over 3 months without even a single word from the devs [they could easily have reverted to the previous working version until this one was fixed if they planned to continue updates].

Now the only conclusion all the players reached is that the project has sadly been abandoned, and is only being left online as a cash grab. Many previous players have reported that there are no replies to their emails sent to the studio and devs.

This was one of the only multiplayer games I enjoyed -- really miss playing it, but the last update made the game unplayable for everyone... The game went from an Early Access peak of 1800+ players online to play down to 30 or fewer new purchasers trying to play it [most are having to refund while they can].

http://steamcharts.com/app/352460

I would have gladly given the game an 8.5/10 with the previous version -- sadly now I can't even give it 1/10 because it is no longer playable [the loss of character control isn't a minor bug because player control is critical to playing the game].

Unless a dev returns to pick up working on the game again some day, I have to give it a sad 0/10 and warn that it's currently just turned into a cash grab.

Before buying, check the forums and you'll see all the bug reports for the last update, and not one single post or response by the devs in over 3 months.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have only had it for a few days, but the results were great; this game has a lot of potential for the future seeing that it has the perfect gloomy atmosphere and the right tone of music for a tense + suspenseful kind of game. When your right in the mood and get caught the jumpscares are perfect, but of course once you see it enough you'll start expecting it and then it won't be as enticing... However when you know you have to run because of the identification of the ghost near you, it certainly gets your heart beating; you sometimes don't know when to stop or turn because things are happening so quickly and gets more and more uproaring as you find ways to juke the ghost.

There are a wide selection of players to choose from such as Grace, Edgar and others (even though that doesn't change the gameplay) plus once your friends get this game with you it becomes a ton more fun, no longer will you suffer from YouTuber fans who always bug and talk about the Famous Gamers and no longer will you find glitch-walling hackers or Jackasses who block the doorways for both you and the ghost (This means the ghost starts targeting you as both are blocked from another player)
You also have special abilities each round, for both ghost and human. Humans have a special bubble shield that once activated the ghosts cannot reap you, although it is temporary it should give you enough time to escape, as well as that you can also place decoys, 2 to be maximum, so you can fool the ghosts and spirits whilst the true you is running away trying to find a new hiding spot. However, for the ghosts you have double jump which is of course easier to capture the humans when they are above in high places and when right-clicking you enable a human-seeking mode which where-ever a human is hiding a red spot is detected, once you are close enough it shall warn you about it giving you the oppotunity to capture them, the only problem that occurs is the fact that when using sprint and the human-seeking ability it does take away your stamina, meaning you need to walk for a little bit whilst doing it again which does give the opposite player an advantage at times... Oh and another thing, as a ghost you can also Press R" to activate Invisibility so the players can't see where you are coming from

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has two game modes - 'Seek and Reap' (jumpscare hide and seek) and 'Bounty'

In 'Seek and Reap', you, as a ghost, aim to 'Reap' (jumpscare) your opponents, making them a ghost. You're able to use supernatural powers to be given hints as to where the enemy is. You can also be invisible, which is pretty cool. As a human, you can drop decoys and place a bubble around yourself, as to divert the ghost. The jumps are pretty decent, and this mode is REALLY fun to play with friends and generally scare the ♥♥♥♥ out of each other.

In 'Bounty', you attempt to find 10 'watches', as a human, at which point a portal will open and you can escape. This is a somewhat more tactical mode, if you can use 'tactical' to describe the game, as the main thing I love about this game is how FUN it is.

A good Early Access game that actually runs very well, has more than one game-mode, more than one map and actually is respectable as an Early Access title, and I look forward to see its progress.

7/10, I may edit the review as more content is added to the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game, I could imagine some people would get scared of this quite easily :D

Overview:
The game is a simple Hide and Seek multiplayer game, with the twist that you can scare hiders (Humans) as a seeker (Ghost and spirit - spirit only seeks in 'Seek and Reap' more). So far there are only two game modes - 'Bounty' and 'Seek and Reap'. In Bounty, the humans have to try find 10 hidden pocket watches while the ghost tries to hunt the humans. Personally, I love how as a spirit in the bounty mode, you can just explore the map and interact with surroundings - gives you the chance to find a new spot for the next round >:] Seek and Reap on the other hand is a little more simple, with the basic element of survival - hide until the time's up. Unlike the bounty mode, humans who have been caught and turrned into spirits can help the ghost find other humans. The game is very straightforward, making it easy to get accustomed to the game and can be enjoyed for hours due to the simple desire to try find the best hiding spots and strategies - a few of which I have discovered myself and I bet you can't get me on the Fireside map >:]
But in all seriousness, the game is definitely worth the money and great fun, especially when you get to talk to the other players - giving the game more suspense and getting some funny moments and reactions from giving someone a jump-scare.

Ideas:
The only thing that I believe need fixing is the mouse sensitivity and for additions to the game it would be great to have an in-game typing chat since some people either prefer to type or don't have a mic or whatever. Also, I think it would create a slightly more scary environment if some of the paintings were animated at random times or when you walk nearby (e.g. eyes following you) or if the statue of Huxley itself could be animated in some way - tbh, Huxley might even be a good additional 'ghost', giving players an extra choice. Since all I can tell from my experience so far, however limited it may be, is that the ghosts only have audio and visual differences, maybe it would be interesting to implement special abilities for each ghost - for example, if the wolf could sniff out the humans or if the baby could place a baby doll or something down as some sort of scare trap. Just random ideas. Perhaps that would make it more interesting and maybe even make certain ghosts better on certain maps, allowing for player strategies to develop.
I also noticed that the ghosts talk when you press 't' but the humans do not, maybe that could be changed so that humans can taunt?
That's all I've got... for now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is an indie multiplayer “horror” game. Gameplay consists of a hide and seek system, with one person as the “ghost” and the rest as humans. The humans and the ghost characters have different types of abilities that if used properly, could capture and reap (the ghost’s skills), or evade and fend off the threat (human’s skills). As with any multiplayer game, Dead Realm is best played with friends so if you got some buddies, poke and command them to buy the game and play with you. If joining a public lobby, up to 8 players can join.

Truthfully, I didn’t play around with Baby William or the Wolfman because I wanted to be the one getting scared so I only know a little bit of how the ghosts works. Despite that, I will list my observations during my time as a human and as a ghost.

As a human, there are various hiding spots that sometimes can be reached via platforming sections and knowing the locations of these hiding spots in each map will hinder the ghost from finding its prey. Checking the cameras for the ghost’s location once in awhile will prolong the human’s life but they cannot linger in the cameras too long since they are vulnerable and the ghost will take this chance and reap their soul. Amongst the human’s arsenal, they can create decoys of themselves, which can distract the enemy momentarily and a barrier, which is effective if activated in front of the door during a chase because if a ghost is following, the person can simply pop that barrier up and slow down their assailant. These are useful tools to have but they are not infinite so a smart human will use them wisely. The humans are also equipped with an EVP recorder, which allows the detection of a nearby ghost so keeping an eye on this device is imperative for their survival.

The Ghosts have the means of catching its prey by hearing and seeing their heartbeats(?). They can also taunt and tease its prey out of hiding. Additionally, the ghosts can also cloak themselves. Timing the use of the cloaking skill is important. Lastly, one similarity that the humans and ghost posses is the energy bar. Running and using abilities will take a portion of the energy bar so it’s best to keep an eye on it.

There are 2 game modes for now. Bounty and Seek & Reap. It’s a standard find the human, save the world…I mean, the ghost’s job is to search for the humans and reap them. All the humans need to do is survive and avoid the ghost until the timer runs out. Pretty simple. I haven’t played Bounty as much but basically humans need to collect 10 pocket watches so that they can escape and the ghosts, of course, must prevent them from collecting the watches.

For an early access game, it is playable, with little drops in framerate and enjoyable gameplay. The graphics is decent enough. I was a bit disappointed that I barely got a scare out of the game. I was looking forward to that. I joined several random games, thinking that one will get me but nothing. I played with a few friends, and by then, I’ve gotten used to the game. For me…I repeat, in my opinion, the Wolfman is not scary (Granted, if a wolfman is chasing me in real life, I would just freak out and probably hide in the corner, bawling like a child) and the bloodied baby, William, looks really cute, man. How the heck is he scary? He’s so cute, yes he is! *ahem*

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=495710939

What I really want is that grud…gru…the lady from that Grudge movie (I cringe every time I remember that movie. I still have PTSD from that movie) or similar to it. I want her crawling and making those unnatural sounds. Oh that would be a dream.

And please, wear headphones and turn that volume up. The atmosphere can get unsettling for new players and the ambient sounds are not too shabby. Although, now that I think about it, there is a mic chat in-game (push to talk) and if you got people squealing in your ears, I won’t blame you if you turn the volume down (but there is a slider for the VC, which I am grateful for).

All in all, it’s a pretty good game and a fun distraction. I can’t see myself playing it for long periods of time but hey it’s a fun twist to a favorite children’s game. I recommend it. 14.99 is a reasonable price. The developers are actively patching the game and they seem responsive to their player base.

Here’s me fooling around in Dead Realm with some friends. Watch it at your time. Thanks for reading!
Dead Realm video

Early Access Review

Really fun on seek and reap so far.
Recommend to play with friends.

Pros:
So many spots to hide - these won't get memorised and become boring (i believe)
Fun interactive locations - you can hide in ovens, cabinets and cookers which is hella cool
Maps are large and each one uses a different skill (hiding, running, parkour)
Custom servers
Friendly community (from what i can see)
Scare factor at a satisfying level

Cons:
Servers can be very laggy at times
Limited maps for now
You can find people too easily with the abilities so there are no permenant spots to sit in
The people can too easily outrun the ghosts

Suggestions:
New gamemode with absolutely no abilities available and it's just a good ol' fashioned hide n seek where once found you're caught

Overall it's a really good game for early access. It seems they're very keen to add more maps and monsters to expand it and considering multiple famous youtubers are there supporting it, I don't think it will be abandoned. I definitely recommend this game to play with friends for a better experience.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Absolutely horrifying. Think of what Damned wanted to be, and multiply it by 11. No weapons. No ways to directly combat the demons. Dead Realm has grasped what players have wanted in a multiplayer hide-and-seek survival horror game. From giggling like a little girl as a ghost while you taunt friends and strangers alike, to shaking unendingly and whispering for your friends as a human, Dead Realm is a truly terrifying experience that should not be missed out on, especially for fans of the survival horror genre. Lag and other trivial issues should be dealt with promptly, as Section Studios appears to be a trustworthy indie developer.

Vanoss and SeaNanners on YouTube have already proved Dead Realm's fun and worth; why not give it a shot?

9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access review, opinion may change over time (or not, who knows!)


Intro:

Dead Realm is a multiplayer hide and seek GEM. Hide and Seek games is something that the game industry lacked. Now that Dead Realm is here i feel i can safely say that I (as a gamer) am hugely satisfied with the Hide and Seek genre because Dead Realm has all the basics you want in a Hide and Seek game. Not to mention its early access so it is bound to be shaped in the way that everyone wants it to be!

Is Dead Realm a scary game?

Yes and No. Dead Realm is scary to an extent. I would say you get more thrills from playing than you would a terrifying feeling that someone is watching you. However that doesent make it any less of a game. The tension of hiding from a monster and hoping that you wont be found is intense. You genuinly feel your heart begin to race and your fingers become clumsy as you look around for the creature. The thrills increase even more when you are trying to escape the monsters clutches! (i would also reccomend using headphones and increasing volume on them, just for the extra excitement!)

Do I need friends to play Dead Realm?

The game is better with friends i admit, however it is still incredibly fun with random people. The only point i would make on this question though is that it is a LOT funner if you have a usable mic. Being able to talk with the other survivors and hear them scream as they get caught is one of the best things about the game. However there is one thing i will say, this game needs more people! I feel as though Dead Realm doesent get the attention it should have. A multiplayer game needs its people, so please do tag along for the ride.

Is the game fair for both seekers and hiders?

It all depends on the persons skill. Neither side is more handicapped than the other. What i comes down to is whether or not you have the skill to survive or reap. Survivers are equipped with decoys to delude the monsters as well as shields they can deploy to escape from the monsters if being chased. On the other other hand the monsters have a double jump ability, a human sensing ability (the humans also have something similar for the monsters) and best of all an invisibility ability which makes the jumpscares all the more intense!
Note: Only the starting monster has the ability to go invisble.

Is it worth buying this game now?

Yes yes and YES. Early access or not this game is too much fun to just pass up on. The pricing is more than worth it for a game that you will eventually receive even more on!

So hurry up people, find some time to come along and hunt or be hunted on Dead Realm!

10/10 would reap again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In my 1.2 Hours of Gameplay, I have to say that I love this game. It's fun and entertaining but there are a few issues with it. Without friends, the game is slightly dull but that can be made up by talking to other players in the game itself, if they have a headset. Sadly, however, my headset does not seem to work on the game despite my ability to hear other players through my headset. Another issue that I have found with the game is that there are few servers to join, most of the servers are locked, unless you constantly refresh the game and, even then, you might not find a server you like.

The game is very spooky and when the ghosts come out of nowhere to reap you, you will scream like a little girl and sometimes cry. (I have never cried!) I know I've only mentioned the negatives in this post, as they are the primary thing hurting my gameplay, but there are plenty of positives such as the paranoia, jump scares, controls, and all around entertainment associated with this game.

I recommend this game to anyone considering buying it. I will update this post when I play more into the game. I just thought to, currently, give my opinions on the issues I am having.

----

In my 2 hours of gameplay, I've found that more people are having the same issues with headset compatability as I am and that it is not just me. There are still plenty of people who do talk in-game as well so there is no lack of sociality in the game itself. What I find this game still needs is an in-game typing system so people without headsets could still communicate with others. There are some lag issues considering it is a peer to peer connection but, other than those things, the game is still good.

Continuing on with the review. I will simply say that I continue to recommend it as it is even more fun than I thought from my 1.2 hours post. I would never consider refunding my money. Time goes by so fast because of the paranoia in the game and how quick the rounds go by. Needless to say, I screamed like a little girl when I was reaped, on several ocassions, and nearly cried due to being chased by six spirits. The maps are very extensive and have several hundred places to hide, which is amazing, but sometimes getting to them is annoying. Even though I haven't played a lot yet, I've found so much fun in the game itself that I'm still finding new places to hide especially when you're running for your life. Being the spirit is a bit complicating and gets fairly annoying at the beginning but it does get easier the more you play, just like any game.

Many people bought this game due to Vanoss's, and his friend group's, videos and mention of it but I was skeptical. It seemed as if this game could get dull fast but it seems to be impressing me so far with its constant paranoia and ever-changing chases. The game currently has 3 maps and 2 game modes, all of which are well made. Seek and Reap is a Hide and Seek game mode and Bounty is an objective based game mode, both of which are highly entertaining and completely different from each other.

Again, I recommend this game to anyone who is considering buying it. I fought my skepticism to buy it and it was the best $15 I spent in a long while. I will continue with my review based on the more time I spend on the game. (Sorry if this seems sloppy, I'm not really thinking of what to write, just writing what I feel about the game.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is one of the best early access games that I have played in a long time. With The Forest, Stranded Deep, and H1Z1 in my game library I have found that most early access games are released too broken therefore turning you off to the game entirely or making you think that the development team is short on cash. Dead Realm however seems to be the most complete early access game that I have ever played. It has very little glitches or problems that I have experienced throughout my game play.

The gameplay is great! Playing with friends is awesome as well as just joining a random lobby. Seek and Reap is in my opinion the most fun because of the chaos that can be created by shortening prep time, extending play time, and adding more players. Bounty is a great game mode that reminds me a lot of Slenderman. You have to walk around the map looking for watches that spawn pretty much anywhere on the map as the always invisible ghost hunts your team down. This mode offers more scares then Seek and Reap, but is harder to actually complete. All in all both game modes are amazing. The scare factor in the game is fully dependent on the skill of the other players. Are you going to get scared every time you get caught? No, but there are times where you get very much caught off guard and sent flying into the air.

Things to improve would obviously be bug fixes, but as I said before there seems to be very little of them. Adding game modes, maps, and playable humans are a must and I've already heard that this is in the works. Upgraded servers or some way to lower pings for players would be another must. I have mostly hosted my own severs, but when I do play on some others my ping can be a little too high causing the game to lag just a little bit to much. Knowing who is talking is another thing that I would love to see added but isn't a must. My suggestions on a new ghost would be a Clown, map would be a haunted/abandon school or church, and for human characters it should be the YouTubers who creatively designed the game.

Early Access Review

I bought this with the hopes for a scary game that I could play with friends. After the first couple of jumps it lost its 'fear factor' and became more of a game of tag than a scary version of hide & seek. (Ironically enough this was especially the case of the actual hide and seek gamemode as the ghost could see easily locate you so there was no hiding). The other gamemode I thought was very interesting but the stopwatches you needed to locate were near impossible to find within the time limit, especially with dwindling numbers as the ghosts caught up with you.

Having said that it was a good fun for the first couple of games. I'm not going to recommend it as of right now, especially if you're searching for an actually scary game but I will most definitely be keeping this on my watch list as I do have high hopes for this game further into development.

Also I wish there was a neutral recommendation rather than simply yes or no.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have bad experiences with games like this.

Take Depth for example...Two players play as sharks...Four players play as human divers...Looks amazing on the surface, lots of awesome trailers, lots of fantastic screenshots.
But then the game itself is honestly a glitchy, buggy mess that is COMPLETELY impossible and pointless to immerse yourself in when some idiot from Russia decides it's a good idea to play on a North American server and have 500 Ping, glitching all over the map like a tiger shark hyped up on coffee meant for The Flash.


...Dead Realm takes that game genre, and does so many things right, that it doesn't matter.
The important thing is to not take Dead Realm as a 'realistic survival horror'. That's not the point. Take it more like a game of Pacman with a multiplayer function. That's much more like what Dead Realm aims for.


Gameplay
First of all, I need to stress again, that this game needs to be taken with a huge chunk of salt. It is not a picture perfect game with flawless graphics and deep, intense controls where you create weapons or struggle in a melee fight with the monster etc. etc. It's a cat & mouse game, end of story.

There are several game types to choose from:

Seek & Reap
The standard game type. A server can hold up to 8 players total, where 1 is always the monster, and 7 are humans. The job for the humans in this game is to survive for a Host-decided amount of time without getting caught by the monster. Naturally, the monster's job is a polar opposite; kill every human within the time limit. To assist them, humans come equipped with 'shields' and 'decoys'. Shields create a spherical bubble which anyone, humans and monsters alike, cannot pass through, except the one who created it. This is a good way to block a monster's ability to chase you for long enough for you to flee and find a hiding spot. Decoys are an exact replica of the player's character, but it cannot move. When a monster tries to caputer it, it'll simply vanish. One last weapon for humans, is their Ghost Tracker app, which can be used by right clicking. This works similarly to the monster's tracking ability, letting you know only when a monster is nearby by making scary faces and noises.
Monsters get a unique bonus depending on the monster chosen. From double jumping, to faster sprinting, to situational speed boosts. All monsters come equipped with a location sensor, providing them with temporary bubbles on the map to locate enemies. This bubble vanishes when in close proximity, forcing the monster to rely solely on sight to finally locate the human.
When a human is captured, they turn into a Ghost. Ghosts assist the monster, chasing humans and being able to do everything the monster can do, short of their special monster-specific ability. They can, however, still track humans, but can only run at human speeds.

Bounty
A slightly harder game type. Humans are unable to use shields or decoys unlike in Seek & Reap, and monsters are invisible. Additionally, ghosts are spectres instead, and cannot capture humans like in S&R. Instead they are invisible, and can only manipulate things like doors and ventilation grates. It is each spectre's choice whether to help the monster, or the humans.
The humans' job is to avoid the invisible monster, while searching for 10 pocket watches. Once 10 have been found, a portal opens somewhere on the map. Every human who stands in the portal will be uncapturable, and win the game.

Hardcore Bounty
Same as bounty, but with crippling handicaps for both sides, such as the Ghost Tracker app's battery does not recharge. Monsters cannot sprint, etc. etc.


The game is still new, and only comes with a small handful of monsters, and with three or four maps.


Graphics
The game's major drawback. Graphics are a bit out dated and not really that impressive. Then again, this game's focus is on gameplay and sound, not graphics, thus decreasing its quality. Still nice enough to give a very spooky world to creep around in, though! But no, it's not eye candy.

Sound
Ace in the hole. Seriously. The sounds in this game makes up about 40% of the entire experience. My heart rate barely went up when I 'SAW' the monster, and knew it was chasing me...But when I was standing inside a closet...And hearing that monster's feet thumping around in the room with me, searching for my hiding spot, my heart was ready to jump out of my chest. It's such a simple little detail, but it makes the game go from a 5/10, to an 8/10 for me.


Conclusion
If you're into horror games, and got some friends to play with, or if you're simply a social gamer who likes to interact with his or her fellow players? Then this game is made for you, specifically. It is a fantastic game, and once you get over the fact that there's no eye-candy to look at in the game, and simply take the game for what it is? You'll be very pleasantly surprised.
Additionally, the community is Grade A material, if my experiences are any indication of general truth. I've met two good friends through it already, and nobody seems to be inherently rude, unlike in games like CS:GO where you can't really do anything beneficial to your progress without provoking the enraged frustration from some 12 year old with anger issues.
Definitely recommended.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Feast your eyes on the awesomeness that is Dead Realm! This is a brand new, multiplayer horror game with a focus around hide-and-seek style gameplay.

When starting the game you either spawn in as a Human or a Ghost. As a Ghost you get to pick between being a Wolf Henchman" or a terrifying Baby that has similarities with Chucky!

As a human you're objective is to run
date: hide and survive! You have the ability to summon 2 decoys per round and pop 3 shield bubbles to aid you in your escape. As a Ghost you're objective is to hunt the humans and reap them
recommended:
effectively taking their soul!

Humans who have been reaped turn into Spirits and then go about aiding the Ghost to hunt the remaining Humans until the end of the round.

In order for Humans to win only one of them needs to survive. In order for the Ghost to win all Humans have to be reaped.

It's a great game with plenty of jumpscares around every corner and the added element of traps
hoursPlayed:
hiding places and stealth/shield abilities makes this a brilliant game of skill and terror!

11/10 Would require new pants again.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V8TyssHIu7E"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My horrificly good experience playing Dead Realm....

My brother and i bought this game because we were bored and looking for something to do to pass some time... Little did we know that we were about to have 8 to 10 mini heart attacks over the next hour. After we both installed we were very egar to play seeing as this game looks like it had potential to be great...and it delivered. I made a private game for the two of us and i spent my first round in the game as a human. I ran around looking for a place to hide, with so many options i prob chose the worst one, behind a movable box. Then The ghost has been released" pops up on my screen and suspense is mounting. In the distance i hear a pitter patter of what seems to be some sticky fat little feet slapping the ground. But with so many creepy sounds and noises in the backround i dont think much of it. But the noise of those chunky soda covered feet sounds like its getting louder and closer. My heart begins to race not really knowing what to expect
date: i wasn't even sure i would be found but this game has a way of putting you on the edge of your seat. Finally the footsteps are closer than they've been the entire time
recommended: they sound like hes standing right ontop of me. And then....scilence.... I could hear a pindrop at this point. I become anxious and start getting antsy behind my pathetic excuse for a hiding place. 15 more seconds pass and i still dont hear anything so now im starting to think he may have passed me. I crouch walk my way into the closest room
hoursPlayed: easing my way past bookshelves. As i round the last shelf i turn to my right and what do i see. A giant headed baby bathsoaked in blood with the creapiest little smirk ive ever seen. He pounced me and i ♥♥♥♥ my pants a little bit as i screamed like a 10  year old girl at a Jonas Brothers concert. I cant even look at my 18 month old son the same anymore and when i hear him run across the tiles of my kitchen floor it gives me PTSD of my horrific encounter in Dead Realm. 10/10 would ♥♥♥♥ my pants again"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay so i've played this game for a bit now and i really really love it. A lot of people complain about the price, which is totally understandable  because 14.99€ is a lot for a game like this. Sure, it's an Early Access Game and i guess there are gonna be new monsters and gamemodes but to be honest, for me, 10€ would've been enough.
Let's just say, the atmosphere is amazing. I love the maps and all the (secret) hiding spots, i think the maps are really well designed. Also, the smartphone" option is really great
date: once you get used to it you can actually escape the monster/tell where it is (if it's near you). I don't know if the Wolf does make any sounds but you can definitely hear Baby William's foot steps which just increases the whole atmosphere and tension.\nOverall
recommended: i think it's a great game to play with friends or even strangers
hoursPlayed: it just really needs an ingame chat for the people who either don't have a mic or don't wanna talk."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really enjoy Dead Realm. It's a great game to play when you have a lobby full of friends and can be genuinely scary sometimes! The atmosphere achieved by the current maps and through the game play (especially hide and seek) is unparalled. Hide and seek is my favourite game mode as it's a little more intense granted players don't have abilities.

Setting up a server is very easy and the server control panel is easy to use to configure your lobby.

Never have I ever screamed so much at a game. I'm very excited to continue playing this game and see it develop into a full game. This game is very high quality for it's simplicity - but that's what makes it so much fun. Da Vinci said, Simplicity is the highest form of sophistication" and this game holds true to that.

Easy

Early Access Review

This game is amazing!!! This just shows you what can happen if people get to gether to make a game.
pros: the scare factor is reall this game is so terrifying you never know when your going to be caught and when you do get caught make sure to have an extra pair of underware with you XD .

game play is very smooth and it quickly became natural as to when you should use your abillitys.
The cameras were an awesome idea (i do have a complant about them further on) its was funny and scary to watch as your fellow humans got reaped one by one making this a great addition to the game


Cons: match making should be a little more specific and should give you an  idea as to how manny pings that lobby is for you (before the game starts). The battery life for hacking the cameras and using your ghost detector is two long , while me and my friends were playing we easily figured out how to stay away from the ghost by using the cameras for a long time, we were able to give warnings and continue to track the ghost for prolonged times witch took the fear factor out of it a bit.

This as of right now is a 8/10 for me witch means you will not regret this purches it will be a 10/10  if those things are adressed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is a horror-themed hide&seek with interesting variations.
There are three maps, and they are very large and detailed, with dynamic objects (wardrobes, doors, conduits, lifts and movable boxes).
Customization and progress are almost entirely absent (there are only a few achievements and character models). This can be negative or positive depending on the player.

The graphics are enjoyable, but smells old.
The game window - often - freezes and immediately resumes, moving the view up.

I recommend it, with a low priority.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There isn't much to say about this game for now, since its in Early Access, but so far, no major problems, I've listed the kinda 'perks' of playing this game.

Pro: You can scare your friends to an extent that they'll shout or scream in teamspeak or any communication platforms for that matter, you can be a stalking wolf, a tedious grandma, a lumpy fat kid who wants his candies and the butcher who just wants friends.

Con: You get an adrenalin rush when you've been spotted and you pretend like you're juking but in reality you're actually panicking.
And also don't forget about the lag. Dead Realm needs Dedicated Servers, it seems anyone I play with cannot host a seven player game, and that's seriously why I don't play this game as much as I want to, even if its in Early Access.

Also you might also consider to look at the System Requirements, a decent PC is fine, but if its anything below that, its a no no.

Thanks to my buddy Gem, I own this game, but if you're going to plan to buy this, i suggest you wait for them to finish the game to buy it.

10/10 would not host again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Nice concept, terrible execution. I took the chance hoping that this game turned out better than Damned. I was wrong - even at $5, I regret the purchase. Fair warning: some Youtuber with a decent following posted a highlights video of the game that makes it look like quite a blast. They've acknowledged they are friends with the developer and that the video is to help them out. YMMV" is an understatement.

+ Nice concept

-/+ Good variety of creature types to play as. Unfortunately
date:
monsters with the "sense players" ability such as the wolfman are so effective as to make the other selections pointless. Some of the other monsters don't even seem to have abilities; they're essentially skins without the ability to detect players.

- You can play hide and seek with your friends for free.

- Despite playing on Halloween

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nHaven't really played this game a lot but I will admit it is real fun. When playing as the ghost you can choose between a creepy ♥♥♥ baby and a not as scary wolfman. Playing this game with friends is amazingly fun and the feeling that you get when you're being chased is great. The only bad thing about this game so far is the right-click when you're a ghost. Right clicking reveals where all the humans are and in general is not very fun. My friends had an idea to where you can only use your right-click once per game which made the game much more fun and challenging. This game is great to play with friends and I would recommend it. Although you might want to make sure your friends get it or it won't be too fun.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo, Dead Realm. This is probably one of BEST scary games out there. Why? Let me tell you. First off, its hide and seek you get the feeling that you are being chased. Adding onto that its a scary game. A Wolf And A Baby chasing you? Scary enough. Most of the negative reviews are just saying about how the jumpscares weren't scary. Now, firstly when you know a jumpscare is coming then you know your gonna get scared so you look away. But when you dont know when a jumpscare is coming you jump. (Or there just cowards that cant be bothered to turn their volume up) The Ghosts And The Humans both have their advantages. Humans can use their radar to check if the ghost is nearby. They also can hack the security cameras to find where the ghost is. And they can sprint longer than the ghosts (Only In Hide And Reap) They can use Shields to protect them and decoys to trick the ghosts. Ghosts are powerful aswell. Ghosts are able to see humans through walls for a few seconds but when they get close they have to find him in that area (Only in Hide And Reap) They can also drop banshees to alert the ghost to the humans posistion (Only In Bounty) When they kill a human they'll turn into a spirit and they'll have to help the ghost to reap the other humans (Only in Hide And Reap) The Starting Ghost can turn invisible for a few seconds. (Unlimited In Bounty) 2 modes. Hide And Reap and Bounty. Bounty is like slender but there is 10 watches that you'll have to find and the ghost is always invisible and if you run the ghost will see you through a wall. Hide And Reap is hide and seek but with the ghosts and they must reap the other humans before time runs out. I highly reccomend though to play with friends as it is more fun.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is a similar concept to Damned, except the ghost can run faster than you, jump higher than you, and see you through walls. The survivors have shield and decoy abilities to help them, but unless the ghost player is just a complete idiot they're pretty worthless. Instead of having each level be a map full of keys and codes that you have to find and use to make your way through the maps, most of the rounds are just based around hiding and surviving for a time limit, with one game mode where there are 10 stopwatches spread around the map to pick up and use to power the exit portal. If you can run Damned (it does have some optimization issues, so it's kind of a gamble), I don't see any actual reason to buy this game in its current state, since even despite being considerably less polished and a bit more buggy Damned is a far more entertaining game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is fun with friends, but still lacks a lot.
I'd recommend it if you buy it with your friends, otherwise I would NOT recommend it.
It's not a game you'll play on your own and enjoy for more than an hour.

Pros:
- Fun (When with friends).
- Immersion.
- Amazing Audio.
- Jumpscares.
- Lots of jump spots in the maps.

Cons:
- Lack of Gamemodes.
- Lack of Maps.
- Bad optimisation for CPU.
- Physics are weird, you can't really pickup anything, only 'push' boxes.
- Playermodels are bright as ♥♥♥♥, don't seem to really fit in with the map's lighting.
- The jumpscares can sometimes be ruined by the camera going into the wall.

Suggestions:
- Music that plays when the ghost runs after you, like in amnesia for example.
- Darker areas or maps that require use of the flashlight.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Eat.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is really fun to play with friends    (hoping you have any).
It is definitely worth the 15€ you have to pay to get the game. (unless you get if from ♥♥♥ or something that way)
To have the best experience i would say that you need at least 5+ friends to play with for it to be fun and not to become boring too quickly, it has some downsides tho, for example: There's only 3 maps to play in and if you learn the layout's  of them all and start playing with people     (referring more to playing with strangers)     it get kind of boring after a while since you know all the hiding spots.      (it basically becomes so that you are in an op spot and the ghost cannot reach you, and it gets boring since there's no challenge)     It starts to become a bit boring since its too easy. But if your'e looking for a game to play with some friends and like hide and seek, then i definitely recommend this game for you and your pal's!    9/10. 1 point away  because there's so few maps and i really think there could be more things to hide inside of and hidden rooms. REALLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I love this damn game. It's orginal. It's fun. It's somehow still scary after 30+ hours of playng it. I find somewhere new to hide everytime I play. Developers are still very active, coming out with new maps and characters every couple of months. You can tell it's a loved project.

But there just..theres just..one thing.

The servers are peer to peer. This can completely ruin the expirence. Atleast with my expirence in the game, most people dont have the internet to host. And then if the game is dead and no one you're with has the internet for it, you literally can't play.

If you connect to someone with a ♥♥♥♥ connection you can't move, you can't hear, then you're dead. Things simply don't work. You can press e 10,000 times and you still wont reap that guy. Voice chat is a miss. I've played a couple games were your voice will playback to you. Because of the lag you can't get into hiding spots. Ect ect ect.
Then in about 1 out of every 20 games you find a good server, and the person thinks they're an overlord for having good internet and they ban you for making a joke about Edward being ugly (sorry ed).

I know this is not exactly dead realm's fault, but it's still a problem that has kept me from playing the game mulitple times.

TL;DR:
Do I reccoment this game? ♥♥♥♥. Yes. Should you wait till it's on sale/out of beta? Yeah, maybe.
voteText: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is quite fun, but the fear and the excitement dries out really quickly. If you don't mind a game being repetitive, then go ahead and buy this. But for this game to really attract more people, they need more hiding spots, bigger maps, stuff like this, because after only a few games, you quickly learn the maps.

It's fun and alright for the first few hours, but afterwards, it just feels like the same thing.

3/5

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is a horror  multiplayer ghost hunting game, where you either run and hide or collect objects to summon a portal to escape.

This is by far the best multiplayer horror game i've ever played. The horrifying environments and scary ghost, makes this game unique, while you are trying to survive with 5-8 other people.

As said before, you can be up to 5-8 players on a map. Currently they have 3 maps, two game modes, two ghost and alot of humans to be. The game has either survival mode for humans like hide and seek"
date: where you use shield or decoys to escape the ghost. If you die
recommended: you become a ghost and hunt the other humans till there isn't anyone. The other game mode is slithly different where you collect 10 clocks
hoursPlayed: that's spawns a random portal in the map. The first human who enters wins. The clocks are hidden or hanged everywhere on the map
voteText: while the ghost is hunting you. If you die in this mode
helpfulPercent: you cannot hunt the humans
votesHelpful: but manipulate props on the map to scare you to death.\n\nThe game has lock on mic
votesTotal: by pressing T.  That means you can communicate with the rest of your team and find good hiding spots or where you might think there is a clock. But! Be aware
votesFunny: the ghost can hear you in a range
commentsCount: where you might expose your location. - And yes

column17: then the one who's playing ghost pisses him self of laughing his ♥♥♥ off.\n\nThe multiplayer part is really good
column18: and i have to admit that this is by far the best multi-horror game i ever played. It's worth the price. So if you like horror games

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Simple pro and con list:

Pros:
-Great maps with interactive enviorments (Trap doors,  crates you can move around, buttons to accses secret rooms)
-Cool characters (For both the humans and the ghosts)
-Security cameras (For all your fnaf needs)
-2 different gamemodes (One where you just hide from the ghosts, another where you have to collect items to escape)
-Easy to make your own lobby to play the game


Cons:
-60 Frames FPS cap with no option to disable it
-Only 3 maps (Early Accses so this can be excused)
-Ghosts heat seeking vision will fail to work sometimes
-The option to kill a human is unresponsive sometimes

I have played about 20 matches my first time playing, everything listed above is from my own short expirence with Dead Realm.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is a great game with a lot of potential, but has some economic issues.
The game is a great Indie, it's an immersive hide and seek type horror game that WILL keep you on your toes. Even though the jump scares aren't that scary, they game is still f***ing crazy.

Most know that this game was imagined by some popular YouTubers. I feel that the YouTubers influnced some of the games price. This game is not worth the $15 price tag, yes I do know it is ealry access but I don't think it will ever be up to the price point it is at. Unless it gets some serious updates. I know it is just an opinion but the game is kinda a scam for money.

Now for the gameplay
Story: 8/10
Performance: 4/10 (Not optimized)
Overall Gameplay: 8.5/10 (Lots of fun with friends and randoms)

TL;DR
Overpriced. Has good gameplay and a really fun storyline. Needs more performance upgrades.

7/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Take it from someone who started playing the game at 11pm, this game is scary. The smartphone mechanic is great for knowing when you're about to get scared and adds to the tension. The invisiblity mechanic as a ghost is also great for tension and scares, but the most impressive part is that this game also pulls off the feat of making humans feel that they have some level of control, instead of being totally powerless like in so many other games of this type. Shields can help humans make a quick getaway and to make the ghost lose their tail, and decoys can fool the ghost's enhanced senses (an ability that I previously thought was very overpowered) by making the enhanced sense pick up on the decoy instead of the real thing.
Furthermore, it's not just powers that make this game great. If you are caught and 'reaped' by the ghost. you join their side as a spirit instead of having to spectate the rest of the match. Hiding spots are also good, as there are some which the ghost often won't be able to get to without an assisting spirit, but they are far from an automatic win. The ghost's enhanced senses also isn't overpowered, as if you get close enough to a human with it (about a room's length) it stops showing the marker and you will have to start searching.

To summarise, this is an amazing game that has implemented some great mechanics to balance both teams, so that instead of it being another 'monster is nearly guaranteed a win' game, it's actually pretty much a 50:50 chance of either side winning.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

BEST CLONE STACKING GAME 2015!!

Yes, I am one of the many converts of multiplayer horror games with a hide and seek or find/hide and seek premise.  Dead Realm is like Damned, only it's not broken and is much easier to 'pick up and play' so to speak.

First off, there are no keys to find.  Yeah, you heard that correctly...no keys.  Imagine a world where you randomly find yourself in a creepy place with a group of stangers who are all trying to find a random assortment of keys and junk that will allow all of you to escape said creepy place, all while running/hiding from a monster, only the catch is that this isn't that world as there are no keys.  That's Dead Realm: creepy places, peeps trying to hide from/outrun a monster of sorts.....and a blessed lack of keys.

Also, Dead Realm is pretty balanced as far as gameplay goes.  For instance, Bounty (and its variations) have the human players searching for 10 watches that will open a portal and allow those that survive for that long to escape. Then there's classic Hide and Seek and Hide and Reap (players that die can roam around as a wraith-like entity and kill surviving players; normallly in Hide and Seek you just become a ghost that can interact with objects, just not the player, hence the 'Reap' part of this additional mode). There's also an arcade mode too which allows for more speed, stamina and ability uses for both the humans and ghosts.  More on the abilities: certain modes/settings allow for the ghost to set banshees that can partially trap a human + indicate their location (other modes/settings allow for the ghost to be able to see your location through walls by using M2). Likewise, certain modes/settings allow for the humans to set clones of themselves up as a distraction (or to reach higher places by 'clone stacking', meaning you set a clone right where you are standing, then jump up on it, set another clone, and repeat as many times as you have clones!).  Also, the humans can activate a temporary shield that can block the ghost from killing them for a few seconds. Also, as a human you can see the ghosts when they are invisible by clicking M2 (the main ghost will be a red mist/aura whereas the wraiths will be a green mist/aura) and using M2, then clicking Z or X will allow you to cycle through security cams (which can often make for hiliarity when watching a player run screaming for his/her life).

There's also a decent selection of player skins/sexes to choose from, as well as multiple ghosts and there's even a little backstory told through radio broadcasts you'll hear now and again.  But let's not forget the scares, and as it stands, this game is just as scary as the rest if not more so.  And believe me when i say that it's not just jump scares - sure it has those for certain, but they never seem to get old.  It's the sounds of stomping/stealthy footsteps as the ghosts stalk the darkened corridors and many rooms of the Huxley Mansion (where the game takes place; the Huxleys being the freaks that became the ghosts you see in the game). It's also when the timer reaches those last 10 seconds (it goes red at 24 seconds, kind of as a warning)......*SHUDDERS*....easily some of the most tension/dread you'll experience while playing a horror game.

Just remember, it's fun to be scared and perfectly natural to poop your pants while playing a game like this.  Honest, you won't be judged.... : )

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is a (currently early access) horror multiplayer game. You and a group of friends (or stangers) all gather in a lobby which usually consists of 5 to 8 people (the more the merrier).

You are given different options of game modes from a classic hide and seek, to a bounty which you need to hunt down pocket watches to unlock a portal in which you need to get to, to survive.

Randomly between the people in the lobby only one is selected to be the ghost and depending on the game mode, you get to chose between several characters with different abilites to help capture your victims *cough* I mean other players.

I highly recommend playing this game late at night when it is dark, it is even more fun when you play with people you know.

I currently give this game a 6.5/10.

Why?
It's still early access, I'll update this when it comes out of early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Altough it lacks content right now, we can't blame them since the game is in it's early stages. But you can have fun nonetheless. The game plays well and is a lot of fun with friends to play or people who do use their mics. I would recommend buying this if you want to have some fun with friends.

One thing though; It isn't scary. After the first two games it's more of a tag than a hide 'n seek game. Ghosts can easily find humans in Seak & Reap (which is the scary hide 'n seek version). And humans can easily spot ghosts.
Bounty on the other hand is unique and extremely fun to play.



Final conclusion: Great game in the future, still fun to play now.

Please note that the only reason I am not recommending this game is basically because of the FPS issues I am facing and not because this game is not fun or worth buying as you may not have the same issues as me

Dead realm is an amazing game as far as I can say, however, I am barely able to play the game even tho I have a system which is above the minimum system requirements and nearby the recommended requirements. Furthermore, I have also noticed that I am not the only one with this issue and there are several more people but they have not received a fix so far.

So far, I have reinstalled my windows, defragged my drive, updated my drivers but nothing has worked.

However, since this is an early access review I believe this will later be fixed but for now the issue still exists.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm is a (currently early access) horror multiplayer game. You and a group of friends (or stangers) all gather in a lobby which usually consists of 5 to 8 people (the more the merrier).

You are given different options of game modes from a classic hide and seek, to a bounty which you need to hunt down pocket watches to unlock a portal in which you need to get to, to survive.

Randomly between the people in the lobby only one is selected to be the ghost and depending on the game mode, you get to chose between several characters with different abilites to help capture your victims *cough* I mean other players.

I highly recommend playing this game late at night when it is dark, it is even more fun when you play with people you know.

I currently give this game a 6.5/10.

Why?
It's still early access, I'll update this when it comes out of early access.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nCurrently Dead Realm is fantastic, it has its scares and it's funny moments. The updates bring cool new things progressively getting it better, Loads of fun to play with friends as the great fun gameplay of survival and hiding from the many ghost characters. I really do recommend Dead Realm as a must buy. It has everything the type of game needs and really does make me happy to have it. I rate 10/10 as because it's a early access game it is so god damn sexy. Good ideas game play, configurable settings which are easy to figure out and you don't need the best PC in the world to play it. That is why I think Dead Realm is a great game for anyone.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Games currently heavily balanced towards the ghost, watch collecting mode is obviously very hard, I played as ghost and since you can see where all the people are at all times it's not really at all hard to kill anyone. The survival one would be easier, except once you kill one person you basically win because that person respawns as a ghost aswell.

Playing as the ghost is far too easy and extremely unrewarding, it's honestly not at all fun or interesting.

As for playing humans, it's not really great either. The movement is massively janky, you don't really get the feeling that you could run away from the ghost at all.

It will probably be better once it's fully developed, but for now the games just not good.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nDead Realm is a fun, multiplayer horror game that is made (not entirely but I understand he was involved in the making of it) by one of my favorite YouTubers: Vanoss. It has a great level of customization, allowing you to break down your character to the dents in his nose using a third-party character creating software. (I personally skipped this because it's not important to me and I proceeded to use a default character) It comes with a variety of game modes with the most basic one being hide and seek, where you have to either jumpscare the other players who are hiding around the uniquely designed maps, or be the one to hunt down everyone. Each side has their own special abilities to aid them in either hiding or seeking. It looks great, sounds great, and is a solid multiplayer horror experience. Definitely pick this up if you have a friend or two to play it with.

This game looked really funny at first when i saw it on youtube when they played it with friends and had tons of fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Recently I tried a 6 player Youtube collab with this game, we had heard so many good things about it that we were all excited to finally play it.  However, after about 1 1/2 hours of trying different modes we found the game quite boring and not fun.  I'm thinking this is just a game that got a push on Youtube because of a large channel playing it a lot.

Basically, I do not recommend this game, in fact, we all didnt like this game so much, we all put in for a refund.  That was the first time I have ever had a collaboration where we all agreed the game was boring and not worth playing.  Don't let all the hype surrounding this game fool you, the scares are weak and the graphics are sub par even on highest settings.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have GTX 760, i7 2600K, 16GB RAM and this game runs totally bad (FPS drops). I tried all settings - ultra,high,mid,low and also turned off anti-aliasing, changed resolution but still the same LOW FPS. The concept of this game is fun but the optimization is the real HORROR.

There needs to be settings like:
1.Game Effects
2.Game Shadows
3.Character Detail
4.Environment Detail
5.Texture Detail
6.Anti-Aliasing
7. Vertical Sync
8. Anisotropic Filtering

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game because of the youtubers playing it (Vannos, Mini, etc.).
I saved up all my money to purchase it... not worth it.

It gets very, and I mean very, boring if you play by yourself.
On the few servers (which aren't official) only one map and one gamemode is played.

If the game was free or maybe $4.99 then I would have kept it.
But $14.99?!?!??! I was hoping that the money spent would be equivalent to the fun I had. Not true.
I have gotten a refund on the game and will NOT be recommending this to anyone.
If you play alone, do not even THINK about buying it, I made that mistake.

Ideas to fix it:
-Official servers.
-Cheaper price
-Widen the hitbox for Reaping

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't get me wrong, it is a great concept but executed in an odd way. This game pretty much requires you to have friends to play with. I had some fun with the 3-4 friends that I played with on it BUT the fun doesn't last. You eventually get bored after a couple of games which are 10 minutes long each. The monster ALWAYS knows where you are (In the only good gametype currently) which eliminates any feel of hide and seek. The monster needs some clue of where people may be, true, but this method is way too OP meaning the monster almost always wins. The monster can literally right click his mouse and it will highlight the players. It does need to be recharged but the range of it is unbelievable.

Pros:
-Good Concept
-Nice abilities such as shield and holograms
-A very unique and original camera system that lets you look through the cameras while you hide"
-Balanced Stamina System
-Atmospheric

Cons:
-The F***ing price you pay for what you currently get is bullsh*t. Waay to high.

-Monsters ability to see you most times is too OP (Overpowered)

-There are currently only 2 gametypes
date: Seek and Reep and Bounty. In Bounty
recommended: you have to find watches scattered around. The monster cannot see you in this gametype but its pointless as you DONT NEED to hide. Seek and Reap is pretty much hide and seek
hoursPlayed:
or tries to be.

-Currently only 3 maps

-Region Locked Servers meaning you cant play with someone outside of your region

-The number of servers out right now is very low

-The size of 2/3 of the maps is pathetic. They do have a lot of hiding spots but that is pointless as you get caught 9/10 times when hiding which is what the most popular gametype is all about.

-Currently only 3 playable monsters


Overall
voteText: its not a bad game
helpfulPercent: but I have to NOT reccomend it for the price they are asking and the current content it offers for that price. Spend your £10.99 (or however much in your money) somewhere else."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAesthetically impressive but that's about the span of worthwhile content to explore in this title. The gameplay is a yawn, host to wild unbalances between hunters and prey. All the freshest monster design available doesn't mask the fact that every choice is the same choice. In time, perhaps, this will evolve into a title worth owning but as it stands, it's a fine idea to skip Dead Realm.

This game is spooky.
I didn't know what to write about in my review, so here's a recipe for pancakes instead:

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon white sugar
1 1/4 cups milk
1 egg
3 tablespoons butter, melted

1. In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg and melted butter; mix until smooth.

2. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.
