reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'd like to say that I found out about Dead Realm from watching Mini Ladd's videos on youtube. They made the game look very funny.

It is not.

If you found this game through any of the gamers related to Mini Ladd (Vanoss, Daithi de Nogla etc.) you should know that this game keeps you on the edge of your seat. It's horrifying, and I like that. It's terribly frightening at times but when you get paired up with randoms that are really bad it quickly gets tedious. I'd say it's a social game that requires a couple of friends to make it truly enjoyable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My Review for Dead Realm.

NOTE: This is my review, not yours. I have different opinions than you do.

Visuals
Visuals in this game are pretty nice, graphics are good and game runs fast for me.

Lag
Lag is to be had in the game (for me) aka the characters not syncing up with time. Apart from that, lag-free.
About This Game:

About This Game
It's been almost 100 years since a reclusive electricity tycoon named William Huxley murdered his family and staff in the most grisly fashion. Among the dead were Huxley’s son, Baby William, and his henchman, the “Wolfman.” Now you and your friends must enter Huxley’s shadowy world to find special artifacts and uncover his secrets before you are killed.

Dead Realm is a creepy, multiplayer action game with beautiful, immersive environments. You can play as either a Ghost or a Human character and work with your friends to run, hide, survive… or die.

Gameplay
Gameplay is good, I love the running animations, and as always, jumpscares scare me alot, especially when you don't expect it.

Overall
Game is 9/10, not 10/10, due to the lag and such.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nreally dissapointed in the settings of the game, overall the game is really fun and i love it but i would not recommend it right now if you don't have a super good gaming computer.  There are no actual settings in the game that allows you to change the graphics in the video settings, so if the game runs pretty laggy for you than you just wasted 15 dollars until they add settings that allow you to make the game playable in your preferences or in your computers handle spectrum. reviewText:
Early Access Review

My Review for Dead Realm.

NOTE: This is my review, not yours. I have different opinions than you do.

Visuals
Visuals in this game are pretty nice, graphics are good and game runs fast for me.

Lag
Lag is to be had in the game (for me) aka the characters not syncing up with time. Apart from that, lag-free.
About This Game:

About This Game
It's been almost 100 years since a reclusive electricity tycoon named William Huxley murdered his family and staff in the most grisly fashion. Among the dead were Huxley’s son, Baby William, and his henchman, the “Wolfman.” Now you and your friends must enter Huxley’s shadowy world to find special artifacts and uncover his secrets before you are killed.

Dead Realm is a creepy, multiplayer action game with beautiful, immersive environments. You can play as either a Ghost or a Human character and work with your friends to run, hide, survive… or die.

Gameplay
Gameplay is good, I love the running animations, and as always, jumpscares scare me alot, especially when you don't expect it.

Overall
Game is 9/10, not 10/10, due to the lag and such.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dead Realm In-Depth Review
For starters I know I only have 11 hours on this game but I also play these games for over 8 hours to give you guys a good review I look at all factors in the game suchs as Bugs, Exploits, Lag, FPS Drops, etc... So let's get started!

I will have the rating(s) that I give it at the end of the review.


Let's Review The DEVs

This is a topic I can go either way about they make mistakes but they also make improvments to the game and all mistakes can be re-coded and fixed!

The Devs have been Away" from updating us about their game which I find frustrating when I buy an Early Acess Game I want to be updated regularly because as an Early Acess buyers we are supporting the creating of this game and we deserve to know EXACTLY what is going on with the money we have spent on this game.

On another note the Devs of this game are great other than leaving us in the dark for long periods of time they do take in our Feedback and apply it into the game on each update which is awesome.


Gameplay

Playing Dead Realm is something that hasn't been done very offtain the only other game I can think of that has attempted this (but failed) is Damned
date:
or Friday the 13th which hasn't been releashed yet.

Dead Realm has smooth Gameplay but at times can have FPS drops but this is an Early Acess so it is to be expected that this kinda thing will happen. The game is scary and intense at times for example when I first played my first game I got so scared that the baby was coming I started screaming then when he got me from behind and I didn't see him until the face popped up I threw my headset and screamed lol.

The gameplay though can do with some work to get around the FPS drops the Graphics aren't the greatest so FPS drops shouldn't happen as much as they do but they promised to fix this issue so we have to wait and see about it.


Community/Servers

I'm going to start this off with saying PLAY THE DAMN GAME PEOPLE the game has 1000s of people who bought it but stop giving it a chance and drop it so without people playing it how are new players suppose to enjoy the game playing by themselves? If you buy an Early Acess game please support it more we want the Devs to want to keep making the game and for people to buy the game and play with us!

The Community of people who I know play this are great people sit there and talk smack to the ghost and the moment you hear the words "I'm coming for you" you shut right up since you know he's around and the smack talk is all fun and games to keep everyone on their toes.

Currently their aren't many people that play but don't let that change your mind on buying it because the game is good we just need more people to start playing!


Rating

The rating(s) I give this game take in account everything I have listed and I hope the review helps you chose if you want this game or not.

Field        Rating                Devs        4/10                Gameplay        7/10                Community        3/10
PLEASE NOTE THAT I WILL UPDATE THIS REVIEW EVERY NEW UPDATE TO KEEP YOU GUYS UP TO DATE WITH MY RESPONES"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game can be fun if you're with a group of friends but only stays fun for about an hour. After an hour you'll more than likely be on the support page asking for a refund.

There's an ok choice of character but there's only a few maps which takes out a lot of the replayability because you play with 2 friends, find their hiding spots then switch map because there's nowhere to hide and then when you're done doing that on the select few maps available you have nothing else to do. The community for this game is dead!

I would recommend this game if there was more people in the community and if there was more maps, without that I would say that the price tag should be about £2 and really isn't worth buying.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is sooooo fun it's ridiculous, especially if you're a massive fan of hide and seek! ...obviously now I'm 25 I look weird if I play hide and seek in real life, but this is a great alternative!

Hiding from the ghost is really fun and scary and watching your teamates all get picked off one by one, after that nail-biting countdown before the ghost is released, is frightening haha. This is the first online multiplayer game I've been addicted to. I can't wait for the patches to see what they come up with next as its already an amazing early-access game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Overview
First off, let me start out with saying that I always thought that the idea of an online survival horror game was a neat idea. It's one of those elusive concepts that have been talked about and tried a couple of times but with nothing really feeling that niche.

Tonight I was looking at the Steam Front page when Dead Realm caught my eye. I asked myself, Huh
date: what's this weird looking baby thing with clocks game?" and quickly looked at the screenshots and skimmed over the description and tags. "A multiplayer horror game...?" I finally thought. Looking at the "Very Positive" user review mark
recommended:
I decided to give the game a shot.


Gameplay
The gameplay pretty much functions as a game of hide and seek. As in
hoursPlayed: 'you hide and this giant baby or werewolf man tries to find and kill you' version of hide and seek. It's pretty well done
voteText: but the servers are choppy and once you play the maps a couple of times you learn the best hiding spots and everyone just flocks to those. The humans have smartphones that they can use to see if the ghost is nearby or check various security cameras to see where the ghost is. The hiding can get somewhat tense at some points
helpfulPercent: especially when you're hiding in a locker and know the ghost is right outside looking for you. I really wouldn't call this game 'scary' - I mean sure it might be scary to some people
votesHelpful: but I like to call this game 'tense'. When you're caught by the monster you're treated to a cheesy jumpscare-esq type of cut scene. Besides that
votesTotal:
the gameplay is still very barebones and lacks the shine that you'd come to expect from early access games.

PROS
Finally a decent online horror game


Can be pretty tense at times


The Humans/Monsters have their own distinctive playstyles


Dev is planning to add more monsters/maps/game modes in the future


CONS
The servers are pretty choppy - however the game is still very much playable


Full of Early Access bugs and problems


Not much content currently - everyone pretty much just plays the hide and seek game mode


Conclusion
Pick up Dead Realm if the idea of a multiplayer horror game interests you - or if you're a horror game fan. It probably won’t interest people who aren’t interested in horror games but it still is very much fun in its current state and unlike anything else I've currently played"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game has the worst connection ever. You have to connect to a host player which always has some sort of processing that means that if you play with your friends you have at least 100-200 ping as a minimum. If you are buying this play on a proper server or don't bother. The games lag handling is also terrible as it doesn't just rubber band or frame drop, it allows the cursor to continue when you stop moving and also not allow you to reap (how you kill others in game) for about 5 seconds of being locked on, which is impossible as your cursor always goes past the point. No-one ever seems to play it, I hope this tells you why.

overall, i would highly recommend this game!

Early Access Review

It's Hide&Seek with different modes. And it's early access but there are very little bugs left.
They update it regular and game contents a lot of fun.

Only greater problem is peer-to-peer host, but it could be worse.
There is still some balancing to do. Especially Bounty is very hard for humans.
And some people always leave before game is over.

If you want some scare jumps and playing short fast rounds then this is your game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Flawed as it may be, I can see the potential. With a few more game modes, characters and features, this could be an excellent horror-themed multiplayer game.

Like I said, there are a couple of issues. For one, it's a little too easy for the ghost to find people. The radar sense makes sense for the humans as it builds tension to know that the spirits are approaching as you cower and hide, but it makes hiding much less viable when the ghost can get an accurate read on your location fairly easily with his own radar, which is actually better than the human's.

Another problem is reaping humans. At times it can be difficult to lay your ghostly hands on them, especially when they're moving. It's a 50/50 chance of whether it will actually register your clicks and actually tag them, even when you're basically touching them already.

But again, flawed as it may be, this game really shines when things get chaotic. It's easy to see the potential on display here. I'm eager to see what this game will look like with more additions and a handful of bugs fixed up. Here's hoping this game blossoms into something great. It would be a shame if it turned out to be an overpirced game of tag.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I rarely leave review for anything on steam but just this once I really felt the need to. I was scared of Dead Realm before I played it and I really wanted to be scared, I was also setting myself up for the inevitable dissapointment too because I've never found a game that is actually thrilling to play and makes you so nervous of being caught, most games you would probably get bored of hiding and run around trolling but this.. no.. this game will make you sit under a table for 10 minutes without even moving to look around because you know the ♥♥♥♥ing horrors that wait for you outside, the first time I got reaped I screamed, I'm a 23 year old guy that would honestly say no game could ever make me flinch or scream... I screamed, I pushed my monitor and it fell over... I was not expecting some of the things that are in there.

If you want a game to play with friends that can actually give you a genuine fun time then this is it, only thing I could ask for is more maps (varient of size for smaller or larger groups) more monsters and maybe the ability to ♥♥♥♥ with people more eg turning lights on and off, turning electronics on and off, opening and closing doors or blocking routes from a distance.

great game, great devs.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game has the worst connection ever. You have to connect to a host player which always has some sort of processing that means that if you play with your friends you have at least 100-200 ping as a minimum. If you are buying this play on a proper server or don't bother. The games lag handling is also terrible as it doesn't just rubber band or frame drop, it allows the cursor to continue when you stop moving and also not allow you to reap (how you kill others in game) for about 5 seconds of being locked on, which is impossible as your cursor always goes past the point. No-one ever seems to play it, I hope this tells you why.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's definitely fun with friends and has a lot of potential. However developers need to add much more maps, some more characters and monsters and also maybe add some constant servers for all of the game modes for players who might not have friends online for example or willing to play. Adding some more gamemodes would make it vastly more interesting as well as the game does certainly getsomewhat  repetitive to a lot of people after some time(given theres only so much maps). But overall it's a really fun game that's got potential, but perhaps for some people it isn't worth it's price at the current time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Flawed as it may be, I can see the potential. With a few more game modes, characters and features, this could be an excellent horror-themed multiplayer game.

Like I said, there are a couple of issues. For one, it's a little too easy for the ghost to find people. The radar sense makes sense for the humans as it builds tension to know that the spirits are approaching as you cower and hide, but it makes hiding much less viable when the ghost can get an accurate read on your location fairly easily with his own radar, which is actually better than the human's.

Another problem is reaping humans. At times it can be difficult to lay your ghostly hands on them, especially when they're moving. It's a 50/50 chance of whether it will actually register your clicks and actually tag them, even when you're basically touching them already.

But again, flawed as it may be, this game really shines when things get chaotic. It's easy to see the potential on display here. I'm eager to see what this game will look like with more additions and a handful of bugs fixed up. Here's hoping this game blossoms into something great. It would be a shame if it turned out to be an overpirced game of tag.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThere's not a bunch of content yet but that doesn't seem to really matter since most people won't be putting in chunks at a time since the atmosphere works so well. This game is scary, wether you join a match where no one has a mic so you are running around/crawling in silence, waiting to be attacked or you join a game with a bunch of noisy people who shreik when they get reaped, both add so much tension. Then when you do get reaped and are transferred to the opossing team, it adds a whole new element of fun since you get to be the agressor stalking the humans. There are only a few maps but they are all very well designed with so much detail, the sound design is incredible as you can be crawling in a vent on one side of the map but faintly hear the rattling clunks of the elevator as it goes up on the other side of the map. The movement in this game isnt all that bad, it can get a bit clunky but that will probably be sorted out later. Definitely a great game to play once in a while and get the ♥♥♥♥ scared out of you.
